tweets.text:
A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

In 2015 Storm Desmond caused devastating flooding in #Carlisle 

In 2020 we are celebrating the defences in Melbourne Park now being to a Storm Desmond Level, better protecting 1200 homes and business ahead of winter this year! https://t.co/2EvjCd3YF9

We’ve used our powers of entry at the River Lugg #Herefordshire incident

14 specialist officers from @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil now on site gathering information & evidence. https://t.co/LLCOFQHCox

BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t

@Brentwood_BC  you are a disgrace there is no access for emergency vehicles and Buttsbury is inpassable. Today I was told to locate the drains and complain online... how can you see the drains!
The Remus Animal Sanctuary does not have access either! https://t.co/5opEuV4oQ3

@RichardTreeArt @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Possibly because all funding has been pulled, everyone is stretched beyond decency and there's this covid stuff going on
@HazelTarragon @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Last week!...Had they acted swiftly this catastrophe could’ve been avoided..

@sciencebase @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Ok sorry-my bad! Because you said "bed down naturally" I'd jumped to conclusion you didn't understand about nutrient removal etc, so when I saw you were a science writer & interested in wildlife, I was a bit incredulous - but you're right I shouldn't have jumped to conclusions!

@Nelliefarmhouse @NaomiLWood @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency 1. The protected salmon & trout have just spawned - destroyed.
2. Aquatic insects destroyed.
3. Riparian habitat destroyed.
4. Bat lines destroyed.
5. Standing dead wood destroyed.
6. Increased flow rates downstream washing out: trout & salmon eggs and insects.
1/2

tweets.text: @Gad__fly @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm It's not a meadow, it's fen drain bank, it's meant to have grass. At the time they always mow, it has field scabious and brassy longhorn moths and butterflies, they remove all of that, they could easily wait a couple of weeks until the flowers fade

We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal

As major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire destroys wildlife habitats. @CraigBennett3 : “Devastating incidents such as this one... a vital ‘test case’... for the Government’s ambition to develop a ‘world leading’ environment enforcement structure.” #30by30 https://t.co/NyL4dmZ8OA

tweets.text: @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Well done - EA Drone operator surveying damage at River Lugg at Kingsland site this afternoon - picture editors more at Alamy Live News @guardian @guardianphotos #riverlugg @TelegraphPics https://t.co/SBFVor1VIu

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Did you know about this on 26th November as reported by the Guardian? In which case why has it taken 9 days to act in he face of such devastation?

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Now a prosecution needs to follow _and a proper, meaningful one - not some weedly fine or slap on the wrist. This is intentional, wilful, murderous, destruction and the penalty should reflect that. I am so sick of some landowners feeling they are above the law.

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Please take action on this. Send a message to others that they will not be able to get away with it. Just slapping a fine on a rich landowner will not make a dent. We're depending on you, so please do this properly, publically and to the full extent of the law.

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil You and your partner agencies have a tough job Dave under the current political regime.  Fight the good fight better days will come. Rember you back at Sapphire new to the EA Pete Whalley

Following widespread condemnation of the ecovandalism on the #RiverLugg, the EA have pinned this tweet at the top of their feed. Tonne of bricks, please. Essential to send a signal even the most ignorant and deep-pocketed landowners can understand. Well done @HerefordshireWT https://t.co/bIOGJpcicx

@TheMontyDon Appalling especially as the River Lugg is such an important historical and archaeological artefact for #Herefordshire -  hope @HfdsCouncil @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA and @Jesse_Norman @BillWigginMP can ensure something is done

tweets.text: @sciencebase @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Maybe you need to widen your base to learn more about the ecosystem side of science? 😁

@sciencebase @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Don't know that site, but sounds like standard meadow cutting practise -cut&remove vegetation at end of summer so the nutrients are removed. If you don't, grass outcompetes the other plants and you loose the nectar rich plants&associated insects. It's how meadows were created!
⚠️ Walcot Ford near Drakes Broughton is closed 🤦‍♂️ https://t.co/Uelm7DgKrx
@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Great work. This is diabolical

Thank you to all the @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ForestryComm staff out on site working together to take action on reported damage at the #RiverLugg. Stop notices served and an investigation underway. https://t.co/moayq4k5aR

@EnvAgency @RosieP4 @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm It's happening up & down the country - not just here. Nature, trees, wildlife, greenbelt, green spaces etc. are being destroyed at an alarming rate. Development & economy are king - HS2 as 1 example & billions£££'s of planned roads another + #BuildBuildBuild on greenfield land.
